intro: Charesia, commonly known as the false indigo, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are native to various regions of Africa, particularly in the southern parts of the continent. Charesia species are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their compound leaves and showy, blue or purple pea-like flowers. They often thrive in dry, rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Some species of Charesia are used in traditional medicine and for ornamental purposes due to their attractive appearance.
